articles.title: Southeast Asian venture capital firms expect to be pickier in 2023 than in 2022 - CNBC
articles.description: Venture capital firms in Southeast Asia will probably be pickier next year, with valuations plunging and macro headwinds slowing down growth in 2022.
articles.content:
Venture capital-backed companies only raised $369 billion for the first three quarters of 2022, according to Crunchbase data. A total of $679.4 billion was invested globally in 2021.
